description: Ecologically related to
name: related to

description: An interaction relationship describing organisms that often occur together at the same time and space or in the same environment.
name: co occurs with

description: An interaction relationship in which at least one of the partners is an organism and the other is either an organism or an abiotic entity with which the organism interacts.
name: interacts with

description: X adjacent to y if and only if x and y share a boundary.
name: adjacent to

description: A symbiotic relationship, a more or less intimate association, with another organism. The various forms of symbiosis include parasitism, in which the association is disadvantageous or destructive to one of the organisms; mutualism, in which the association is advantageous, or often necessary to one or both and not harmful to either; and commensalism, in which one member of the association benefits while the other is not affected. However, mutualism, parasitism, and commensalism are often not discrete categories of interactions and should rather be perceived as a continuum of interaction ranging from parasitism to mutualism. In fact, the direction of a symbiotic interaction can change during the lifetime of the symbionts due to developmental changes as well as changes in the biotic/abiotic environment in which the interaction occurs.
name: symbiont of

description: Herbivores, fungivores, predators or other forms of organims eating or feeding on the related taxon.
name: eats

description: Inverse of eats
name: eaten by

description: Inverse of kills
name: killed by

description: An interaction relationship involving a predation process, where the subject kills the object in order to eat it or to feed to siblings, offspring or group members
name: preys upon

description: Inverse of preys upon
name: preyed upon by

description: The term host is usually used for the larger (macro) of the two members of a symbiosis
name: host of

description: Inverse of host of
name: has host

description: Inverse of parasite of
name: has parasite

description: Inverse of pathogen of
name: has pathogen

description: a is a vector for b if a carries and transmits an infectious pathogen b into another living organism
name: vector of

description: Inverse of vector of
name: has vector

description: A sub-relation of parasite-of in which the parasite lives inside the host, beneath the integumental system
name: endoparasite of

description: Inverse of endoparasite of
name: has endoparasite

description: A sub-relation of parasite-of in which the parasite lives on or in the integumental system of the host
name: ectoparasite of

description: Inverse of ectoparasite of
name: has ectoparasite

description: X is a hyperparasite of y iff x is a parasite of a parasite of the target organism y
name: hyperparasite of

description: Inverse of hyperparasite of
name: has hyperparasite

description: A sub-relation of parasite of in which a parasite steals resources from another organism, usually food or nest material
name: kleptoparasite of

description: Inverse of kleptoparasite of
name: has kleptoparasite

description: A parasite that kills or sterilizes its host
name: parasitoid of

description: Inverse of parasitoid of
name: has parasitoid

description: X is a hyperparasite of y if x is a parasite of a parasite of the target organism y
name: hyperparasitoid of

description: Inverse of hyperparasitoid of
name: has hyperparasitoid

description: Inverse of visits
name: visited by

description: Inverse of visits flowers of
name: flowers visited by

description: This relation is intended to be used for biotic pollination - e.g. a bee pollinating a flowering plant.
name: pollinates

description: Inverse of pollinates
name: pollinated by

description: An interaction relationship in which organism a lays eggs on the outside surface of organism b. Organism b is neither helped nor harmed in the process of egg laying or incubation.
name: lays eggs on

description: Inverse of lays eggs on
name: has eggs layed on by

description: An interaction relationship wherein a plant or algae is living on the outside surface of another plant.
name: epiphyte of

description: Inverse of epiphyte of
name: has epiphyte

description: An interaction relationship between two organisms living together in more or less intimate association in a relationship in which one benefits and the other is unaffected (GO).
name: commensalist of

description: An interaction relationship between two organisms living together in more or less intimate association in a relationship in which both organisms benefit from each other (GO).
name: mutualist of
